rules.reasoning: Available memory is low at {data.get('available_mb')} MB ({data.get('available_percent')}%), below thresholds of 512 MB or 10%. Low memory can cause Cassandra to thrash, increase GC pauses, and lead to node instability or OOM kills.
recommendations: Identify memory-intensive processes with 'top -o %MEM' and terminate unnecessary ones
Tune Cassandra JVM options: reduce heap size if off-heap is underutilized, or increase if GC pressure is high
Monitor Cassandra metrics for high memory usage in memtables or caches
Consider vertical scaling: add more RAM to the node
Review application query patterns to reduce memory overhead
